content:
Hi team, I was mentioned by @nagisa's comment about what to do with RLS issues.
https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/58858#issuecomment-927108585

My understanding of the question is (pls nagisa correct me if I misread your suggestion) do we want to handle RLS issues weekly in the T-compiler weekly agenda (was originally one of the goals of #54818)? Can wg-prioritization help? If yes, how?
In #58858 there's a mention about filtering issues by T-dev-tools label, which I am not sure about the lifecycle: who handles these issues? Perhaps dev-tools on Discord?

Or else, update #54818 and exclude RLS? Is RLS actively maintained?
Anyway, just thinking aloud, I'd like to figure out a bit the context :-)

My understanding is that originally the proposal was to have RLS be part of weekly meetings but I'm not sure if it makes sense anymore. I pinged you primarily because you handle the agenda and might have an idea about what makes sense here
To me just closing that issue as won't fix kinda makes most sense.

ok this was mentioned in T-compiler weekly meeting: #t-compiler/meetings > [weekly] 2021-10-07 #54818 and agreed we can stirke rls 1.0 from #54818 leaving a note (I'll take care of it) and close this issue
